glsa.title: MariaDB, MySQL: Root privilege escalation
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability was discovered in MariaDB and MySQL which may allow local users to gain root privileges.

background.p: MySQL is a popular multi-threaded, multi-user SQL server. MariaDB is an enhanced, drop-in replacement for MySQL.

description.p: The Gentoo installation scripts before 2017-09-29 have chown calls for user-writable directory trees, which allows local users to gain privileges by leveraging access to the mysql account for creation of a link.

impact.p: A local attacker could escalate privileges to root.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
